It is like a person who, in a dream, engages in sexual activity with a precious woman. After that person awakens, they remember that precious woman.

The king immediately replied:

World-Honored One!
He further asked the king:
Great King!
What do you think?
If that person grasps at the woman in the dream, is he wise or foolish?
The king immediately replied:
No, World-Honored One!
Why is it so?
Because the woman in the dream is ultimately non-existent, how can there be the matter of desire as an object?
That person is just exhausting himself.
The Buddha said:
Great King!
In the same way, all foolish ordinary beings, because they have never heard the Buddha's true Dharma, when the eyes see various forms, they delight in the mind and immediately grasp them as real;
Because of attachment, there is bondage; because of bondage, there is defilement;
Because of defilement, greed, anger, and delusion arise.

Whether it is bodily, verbal, or mental action, that bodily action is created and then ceases, and having ceased, it does not abide in the east, nor does it abide in the south, west, north, above, or below. Following the end of life, that consciousness transforms and manifests the subsequent mind.
Great King!
That consciousness is not destroyed, and following the exhaustion of karma, that karma is able to manifest, also like a dream at the time of waking.
Thus, Great King!

The final extinguished consciousness gives rise to the subsequent consciousness, either in hell, or as a hungry ghost, or as an animal, or as an asura, or as a human, or as a god. That final consciousness grasps the final birth, and the consciousness accords with that birth.
Thus, the mind and consciousness receive according to karma, but there is no dharma that goes from this world to the other world and takes rebirth.
Great King!
The extinguished subsequent mind and consciousness is called extinction, and this initial mind and consciousness is like one who takes rebirth, which is that subsequent birth.
Great King!
When the subsequent consciousness transforms, those dharmas do not truly come from that place and arrive here. When the first consciousness arises, it also does not go anywhere.
Why is this?
Because of the nature and characteristics of dharmas.
Great King!

The final consciousness is empty of subsequent consciousness, karma is empty of karma, birth is empty of birth, the initial consciousness is empty of initial consciousness, the place of birth is empty of the place of birth, yet the results of karma are not lost there.
Great King!

The final consciousness of birth ceases there, and the subsequent uninterrupted mind, the consciousness mind, proceeds in accordance with wherever it receives the karmic retribution, and thus goes to receive it.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
When the Well-Gone One speaks of the subsequent, all the words
Are merely provisional designations, because provisional designations and thoughts abide.
Apart from the dharma of language, there is nothing that can be spoken,
They speak of those dharmas.
They are not in those [dharmas], the Dharma eye sees formlessness,
What is said to see form, is due to worldly attachment.
Speaking of worldly dharmas as real, seeing non-existence as a combination,
This is what the TathÄgata speaks of, this is called the ground of skillful means.
If speaking for the sake of truth, the eye then does not see form,
The mind does not know dharmas, this is the most secret.
The world speaks of pride, called originally empty without name,
All dharmas are nameless, yet spoken of with provisional names.
